intro: Friedlandia leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered Friedlandia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive floral structure. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are arranged in racemes, often with a sweet fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
